column2: I really enjoyed all the flavors in the ramen. I loved the amount of toppings they had available
column3: and that they offered button mushrooms as opposed to just the woodear. But dang
column5: additional toppings really add up at $1-2 each. I spent $17 on a single bowl of ramen. I also tried their gyoza and shrimp tempura...both were all right. They don't offer the almond pudding/fruit dessert I saw all these pics of on yelp
column6: so that was a bit disappointing. But
column7: I would come back! It's definitely a great place to have in Houston for ramen.
